variant.question: In the evening around sunset, during your final approach, you have wind from the west, and there is haze near the ground. Which of the following statements is correct about visibility in the last phases of the approach?

options.text: Visibility deteriorates in the northern hemisphere but improves in the southern hemisphere.
The blinding effect of the sun is negligible.
The sun is at a low position so it deteriorates visibility even more.
The blinding effect of the sun will be reduced by haze.

variant.question: You plan a flight to take-off from a coastal airfield in hazy conditions during sunrise. Which of the following runways will provide the worst visibility?
Freezing rain can reduce visibility severely by forming..

options.text: mixed ice in the air before hitting the windshield.
ice on the windshield, preventing lookout from the cockpit.
ice pellets by the Bergeron process.
dense fog due to evaporation of a portion of the supercooled droplets.

variant.question: Visibility is reduced by water droplets to 1 200 m. What is this classified as?

options.text: Haze
Fog
Drizzle
Mist

variant.question: There is heavy drizzle at the destination airport. How do you expect the visibility in the short final to be?

options.text: Visibility could be up to 2 000 m, but will be reduced when the sun is low on the horizon.
If there is fog, visibility could be as low as 500 m, but with NO fog the visibility could be at least 3 000 m.
The visibility could be as low as 500 m.
The visibility should be at least 2 000 m.

variant.question: Which of the following phenomena causes a reduction in visibility and is defined as obscuration?

options.text: Lightning from CB clouds during the night.
Precipitation on the cockpit windows.
Sunshine with low sun ahead.
Wide-spread dust in the air.

variant.question: In the evening an aircraft is approaching an aerodrome. The wind blows from the west and the air close to the ground is very hazy. Which of the following visibility conditions have to be expected for the last phase of the approach?

options.text: In the northern hemisphere the visibility will be reduced, on the southern hemisphere the visibility will improve.
The visibility will improve, because the sun will be in the back and the effect of the haze can be neglected.
The visibility is moderate to good, because the blinding effect is reduced by the haze, which absorbs most of the bright sun light.
The visibility may be significantly reduced due to the low position of the sun and the corresponding blinding effect, which is enhanced by the haze.

variant.question: One of the causes of obscuration, in meteorological terms, is a reduction in visibility due to..

options.text: hail.
sand.
drizzle.
snow.
